news_header: Despite significant rainfall in California during 2023, only 25% of the water lost from aquifers since 2006 was replenished. A study revealed that while surface reservoirs received over 90 billion gallons of water, deeper aquifers remained largely unaffected.
news_original_title: Even epic rainfall may not be enough to refill SoCal’s aquifers
news_text: Researchers used seismic wave analysis to assess water infiltration, indicating a promising method for understanding groundwater recovery. The findings highlight the ongoing challenges of drought in the region and the importance of supporting climate journalism.
